Lifting this from a techie bike friend of mine. Thanks Steve V.

Have you been working from home and having quirky problems with VOIP calls and such using Skype for Business (or other similar clients)? Problems can be things like people not able to hear you (but you can hear them), calls dropping, etc.

If so, look and see if your router has a setting for SIP ALG (Session Initiation Protocol Application Layer Gateway) and disable it. In many, many cases this will fix your call problems.

Many home-type routers have this feature, which attempts to manage and optimize the kind of connections used by communication clients, but go sideways and cause it to break weirdly.

It is with a sad and heavy heart that I share the passing of student Sierra Cook. Sierra was a great young lady with a beautiful and glowing smile, a big heart, and a warming personality. The entire families of West Shore Educational Service District (WSESD) and Ludington Area Schools will miss her.

On behalf of the District, I wanted to pass along this very sad news, along with my condolences to the family, our entire staff, student body, and community. Please know that my thoughts and prayers are with all of you.

While words will never replace the loss of any life, we know that this is a difficult time for many. The District and WSESD are offering support for students, staff, and families on Saturday from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm and on Sunday from 4:30 pm to 6:30 pm at Foster Elementary School. We will have support available all next week too. We hope in some small way that this support will help.

Respectfully,
Jason J. Kennedy
Superintendent

The Board recently became aware that community members may have questions about the informational materials distributed by the District on the upcoming bond proposal.

All informational materials distributed by the District were reviewed by legal counsel and determined to be consistent with state election law. Additionally, the use of public resources by the District for a communication about a local ballot proposal less than 60 days before the election does not violate Michigan law. Almost three years ago, on April 28, 2016, a federal court ruled that the “60-day” prohibition was unconstitutionally vague and permanently enjoined the Secretary of State from enforcing the law.

The Board appreciates the trust and confidence that our families place in Ludington Area Schools and strives to work to maintain that trust. Additional information about the bond can be found at www.lasd.net and additional questions can be directed to the Superintendent Jason Kennedy.

Respectfully,
Jason J. Kennedy
